FuncDef:
The cpu-defend host-car pps command sets the rate limit for the user-level rate limiting.
The undo cpu-defend host-car command restores the default rate limit for the user-level rate limiting. The cpu-defend host-car pps command sets the rate limit for the user-level rate limiting. The undo cpu-defend host-car command restores the default rate limit for the user-level rate limiting. By default, the rate limit for the user-level rate limiting is 10 pps.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the rate limit for the specified MAC address.
The value is in the format of H-H-H.

Sets the rate limit for the specified bucket.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 8191.

Indicates the rate limit, in pps.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 128. The default value is 10.

ExtraInfo: User-level rate limiting identifies users based on user MAC addresses and rate-limits specified user packets (ARP, ND, DHCP Request, and DHCPv6 Request packets). By default, the user-level rate limit is 10 pps. You can set different rate limits for different users.
